alerts.name: High Error Rate
alerts.description: Monitors the error rate in the application to identify potential issues early.
alerts.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Transaction WHERE error IS true
alerts.rationale: An error rate above 5% may indicate systemic issues that need immediate attention[0].

alerts.name: Integration Test Failure
alerts.description: Monitors failures in integration tests, particularly for exception handling and resource access.
alerts.query: SELECT count(*) FROM TestResults WHERE status = 'FAILURE'
alerts.rationale: Frequent test failures might indicate critical failures in service logic, which can affect uptime[1][2].

alerts.name: Unhandled Exception Alert
alerts.description: Alert on occurrences of unhandled exceptions within the service endpoints.
alerts.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Exception WHERE handler = 'NONE'
alerts.rationale: Detecting routes that throw unhandled exceptions, ensuring they are appropriately logged and handled[3].
